page.title: 14HOCKLEY SOLE
page.content: Hockley Sole is a mile westwards of St. Mary's Church.It is a large Tudor manor house set in beautiful grounds with many fine specimen trees such as enormous copper beeches,pines, oaks and redwoods.These were planted in the 1920's by the Raphael_Tucks of postcards and greetings cards fame. Until they bought Hockley Sole in 1914 it had been used mostly as a farm.They improved tremendously both the house and the grounds. The next owners added a large swimming pool.When we visited the house we saw the beautiful library with two windows five metres tall and the spiral staircase which leads to the master bedroom.Everywhere there is oak panelling and we counted 37 chimneys! This area was once known as Hockley Hole and was supposed to have been used by smugglers.
